Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding terms of office for Members of the Congress.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the terms of office for Members of the House of Representatives should be increased from two to four years; (2) elections for Representatives should be held during the presidential election; (3) Representatives should be limited to three consecutive terms of office, but should be eligible for reelection after an absence from the House of at least four consecutive years; and (4) Senators should be limited to two consecutive terms of office, but should be eligible for reelection after an absence from the Senate of at least four consecutive years.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding terms of office for Members of the Congress.
